website_summaries.verdict: The Dell 1250c color laser printer's compact frame makes sense for users in a confined space, but its lack of Ethernet and wireless connectivity limits its appeal for networked offices.
pros: The Dell 1250c is easy to set up and delivers high-resolution documents in black as well as color
cons: The printer can only connect to one computer at a time through a USB port in the pack, lacking Ethernet and Wi-Fi networking

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, replacement toner cost more than printer however
customer_reviews.text: Great Color Laser Printer, I bought two!! Only caveat, Dell replacement toner will cost more than printer, but there are 3rd party replacement toner cartridges available on Amazon. I would complain if I could but was easy to setup, toner arleady installed, just plug USB cable (not included). Just tell windows to share printer and anyone in home network can print to it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl H.

customer_reviews.title: Yay and works with macs 10.8
customer_reviews.text: Yup a color laser printer under $90.00 and works with Macs, 10.8 even. but needs a better prefs control. every so often it'll print out a status report, instead of just looking it over on the computer it prints out three pages of 'status'. oh well it's inexpensive compared to most.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for large printing jobs I have at home from time to time. After a while I started getting black blobs printing out rather that the picture I was hoping for. It also does not pick up photo paper that well.
customer_reviews.author: Seestar01

customer_reviews.title: If you just are looking for a basic color laser printer, this will work well.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these printers after purchasing one and seeing how well it prints with my pc. It does not have a fax or scanner, but if you are looking for nice looking laser print jobs, this printer is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Printer
customer_reviews.text: Was looking to replace ink hungry inkjet color printer and this fits the bill. Over 4000 sheets per toner cartdrige and is just as fast at the Epson Inkjet it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Squire

customer_reviews.title: Fine Enough but Nothing Amazing.  Would be better with WiFi capability
customer_reviews.text: Alright, it prints and does that relatively quietly and nicely compared with most noisy ink jet printers but, common, why wouldn't you add wireless printing as a default on every printer? It could be better, oh, and smaller too. Why do laser printes always need to be bulky anchors?
customer_reviews.author: Joel Rosenow

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for occasional color printing
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer for color printing. It is quick and efficient. The original Dell younger is over-priced so compare toner costs when choosing a printer.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Koneman

customer_reviews.title: overall good little printer, but toner from Dell expensive
customer_reviews.text: excellent reproduction, but needs to be turned off then back on after turning on the pc, or it will not print and troubleshooting says that printer is "off-line". Excellent printing and color, however
customer_reviews.author: C L M

customer_reviews.title: seems outdated
customer_reviews.text: i had this printer for a couple years and it was great. i bought another one i liked it so much. one day both of them stopped working and never could get them working again. dell couldn't help, nor could the geek squad. they said a new update rendered the printer useless
customer_reviews.author: dsel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great little color laser, but has only USB, no Ethernet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great printer great price
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these in our home. They are ideal for normal printing jobs and not heavy loads. Beware with paper jams, as printer is not well built and can get damaged internally. they do a terrific job otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: D Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: FAILED AFTER 1,100 PAGES
customer_reviews.text: The headline sums up my opinion of the printer. Perhaps it was poorly designed. Perhaps it was made out of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: G. Franklin Dix

customer_reviews.title: With latest firmware now works fine
customer_reviews.text: Loved this printer when we first got it; print quality is very good, quiet, toner lasts a long time. You need to use Dell toner refills - aftermarket ones don't fit properly. However things have taken a turn for the worse recently. At some point the printer stopped waking up from standby. So now to print we have to unplug and replug the usb cable to wake the printer up. Very nasty, and Dell doesn't seem to be responsive to customer feedback on their forums. EDIT: bumping up to 4 stars, Dell finally posted a firmware update that addresses the sleep issue. So if you get one of these make sure to install that update.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Bad buy
customer_reviews.text: Paper jams frequently. I have to turn the printer off and back on after a jam. Tried to print 4X6 photos, never could figure out how. After printing any kind of a color image the ink is so shiny that my copier will not produce a decent copy of it. It does copy the black printing okay. I have not tried to deal with Dell on the problems. Even if the fixable problems got fixed I still would not like the printer and am not going to spend any more time and money on it. Am just going to junk it and get a better printer (not a Dell).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No problems at all
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot to say, but felt compelled to write this review due to the low ratings. I have had no troubles at all. Best purchase I have made in a long time. I am still on the toner cartidges that came with it, so maybe I have not printed enough to know, but my wife and I have done a at least a few hundred pages with zero problems.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S

customer_reviews.title: Dell 1250c
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Dell 1250c printer based on the film Dell had praising this printer. I wish I had read the reviews first. Every now & then most now, the printer goes into error. I must take all the print films out of the computer, replace them then uninstall the print, log off then reinstall with the disk Dell sent me. I thought since I had a Dell 15 inch Inspiron laptop & a Dell 570 Inspiron Desktop that work great, I figured the Dell 1250c printer would be the same. Bad decision!
customer_reviews.author: David W. Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Very nice print quality but spoiled by sleep mode issues
customer_reviews.text: When this printer works it actally produces really nice quality prints even on standard paper. But you should not buy this printer if you intend to hook it up to a print server. The printer seems to switch off the USB port, so it wont wake up when it see's data. You have to switch it off and on, and in my case I then have to switch the print server off and on as well. It's a pretty major flaw. I tried the latest bios but no luck yet. Come on Dell fix this bug in your printer.
customer_reviews.author: Dr D

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this printer.
customer_reviews.text: This printer has a widely known issue with not coming out of power saving mode: [...] I'd buy a cheaper printer that you don't have to unplug and plug back in every time you want to print if I were any of you. It would be a very simple driver coding fix to just remove the sleep mode, but it appears Dell isn't interested in fixing their software.
customer_reviews.author: sabrelime

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I often print on cardstock, photo paper or labels in my work, which I've done successfully on countless printers in the past. This printer will accept nothing but plain paper...and then often jams anyway. It is absolutely useless to me. I've had good luck with Dell in the past. This makes me very angry.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Malokas

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer prints great! It prints in very high quality with very little noise. It is a smooth printer as well.
customer_reviews.author: RockyMountain

customer_reviews.title: Not Ethernet Based -- As Claimed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this from another retailer in February 2012. The box indicated the interfaces were USB and Ethernet. However, when I attempted to set up the printer I discovered there is no Ethernet port and the printer is not wireless. The CD that came with the printer indicated it was only a USB connection. Took back to retailer.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Ballman

customer_reviews.title: Dell no longer has a phone number in the US
customer_reviews.text: If you need support, good luck. If you want to complain it will be to someone who doesn't care and cannot understand you. You will never find Dell's corporate phone number. They are all phone trees to India. All I wanted to know is if this printer is Lion compatible. No one in India knows what Lion is if it's not an animal. Macintosh is not a specie of Lion. You will never speak to someone in the US. Even the press and investor relations are dead ends.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: photo quality really BAD
customer_reviews.text: photo quality really BAD,oh my GOD. i tried to print one photo as my ID , doubt the technology belongs to the last century.
customer_reviews.author: michael

product_meta.title: Dell 1250C LED Color Laser Workgroup Printer
product_meta.description: Finally, everything you need in an office color printer, but in a smaller package. Enjoy high-quality printouts and fast printing speeds with the Dell 1250c Color Printer, the world’s smallest color laser-class printer1 with amazing color.
feature_bullets: Up to 12 ppm mono and up to 10 ppm color
Standard paper input capacity of 150 sheets and provides a duty cycle of up to 30,000 pages per month
A resolution of up to 1200 x 600 dpi, which produces sharp printouts for both graphics and text

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars36 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
